The person in the video is explaining how he captured a stable, full-frame Moon portrait using a Canon 6D Mk II. The key factor that enabled this result was configuring the Celestron hand controller to the lunar tracking rate so the Moon didn't drift out of frame. This is mentioned in the video as part of the process leading up to capturing the Moon portrait. Therefore, option C is the correct answer.
